meanings.definition: Competing with someone in the same field or for the same objective.
meanings.sent1: The rivalling teams were neck and neck in the championship.
meanings.sent2: The two rivalling companies were vying for the top spot in the market.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see the rivalling siblings argue over who got the bigger slice of cake.
meanings.sent4: The rivalling political parties clashed in a fierce debate.
meanings.sent5: The rivalling chefs battled it out in the kitchen to impress the judges.

meanings.definition: To be equal to in quality or ability.
meanings.sent1: Her skills were rivalling those of the experienced professionals.
meanings.sent2: The new product is rivalling the established brands in the market.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it was rivalling the lion's roar with its meow.
meanings.sent4: The student's performance was rivalling that of the top achievers in the class.
meanings.sent5: The young athlete was rivalling the older competitors in the race.

meanings.definition: To be as good or important as.
meanings.sent1: His contribution to the project was rivalling that of the team leader.
meanings.sent2: The small town was rivalling the city in terms of cultural events.
meanings.sent3: The puppy thought it was rivalling the sun in brightness with its shiny coat.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to the cause was rivalling that of a seasoned activist.
meanings.sent5: The student's artwork was rivalling the masterpieces in the gallery.
